title: Waltz Suite (Prokofiev)
text:
<a href="Sergei%20Prokofiev">Sergei Prokofiev</a> composed and compiled his Waltz Suite, Op. 110, during the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>'s post-<a href="Great%20Patriotic%20War%20%28term%29">Great Patriotic War</a> period of 1946–1947.
In creating this work for the concert hall, the composer drew upon waltzes previously written for three of his most recent works for the stage and screen: the opera <a href="War%20and%20Peace%20%28opera%29">"War and Peace"</a> (completed "circa" 1943–1944 but not yet premiered at that time); the ballet <a href="Cinderella%20%28Prokofiev%29">"Cinderella"</a> (stage premiere, 1945); and, lastly, his score to the 1943 Soviet film <a href="Lermontov%20%28Prokofiev%29">"Lermontov"</a> by <a href="Albert%20Gendelshtein">Albert Gendelshtein</a> and <a href="Konstantin%20Paustovsky">Konstantin Paustovsky</a>.

Premiere.
The work's premiere was conducted by the composer himself on 13 May 1947 in <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>.
